intro: Michelia aenea, commonly known as the silver flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate, ovate leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its bark is smooth and grayish, with a metallic sheen, giving it its common name. Michelia aenea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks.
